issues.description: The findStockIngredient method in the Stock class has a parameter mismatch. The problem statement specifies it should take only one parameter (String), but the template repository implements it with two parameters (String and boolean), while the solution repository correctly uses one parameter. This inconsistency could confuse students, as they might not know whether to modify the template method signature or implement based on the problem description, potentially leading to errors in their code.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the findStockIngredient method in the template repository's Stock class to accept only one parameter: String name, ensuring it aligns with the problem statement and solution repository to avoid confusion for students.

issues.description: The findStockIngredient method in the template repository includes an extra parameter (boolean caseSensitive) not present in the problem statement's UML diagram or the solution repository, leading to confusion about the correct method signature and potentially causing students to implement based on the template rather than the specified requirements.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the template repository's Stock class to define the findStockIngredient method with only one parameter (String name) to align with the problem statement's UML diagram and the solution repository, ensuring students work with consistent signatures from the start.
